name: Maria Rodriguez
content: I practice tai chi under these trees every morning. The energy and shade of mature trees help me heal. Replacing them with concrete would destroy this peaceful sanctuary.

name: Dr. James Chen
content: As a respiratory specialist, I see firsthand how tree removal affects air quality. These mature trees remove 70 times more pollution than saplings - we can't afford to lose them.

name: Community Member
content: The plan is not inclusive and formal, directed, gentrified to a specific culture and economic level. The northwest corner is a functioning, vibrant and quiet gathering place.

name: Local Parent
content: My children play here every day after school. The trees provide essential shade and a natural playground. Replacing this with concrete is absurd given climate change.

name: Christabel Gough, Preservationist
content: Creating a grand vista reminiscent of Mussolini's Rome is not in the Olmsted tradition. This destroys the naturalistic landscape that makes Fort Greene Park special.

name: Michael Gruen, City Club of New York
content: We must preserve the mixture of monumental and bucolic features that make this park unique. The low stone wall and tree grove create the perfect approach to the monument.
